item.title: Dorkly Bits - Angry Birds Friendship
item.description: Angry birds and pigs have a lot in common. For example, neither can fly for some reason.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - 6 Best Smoothie Recipes, Ranked
item.description:
The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is a fun mixture of classic top-down Zelda games and modern 3D ones. For example, it has the art style and some of the gameplay elements of the 2019 remake of The Legend of Zelda: Link’s Awakening .

It also has some mechanics from The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild such as the open-world exploration and the cooking ability. In certain areas of The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom , players will meet various Business Scrubs who can make Zelda various smoothies to heal or boost stats temporarily. Here are the best ones to craft in the game.

6 Warming Potion

Hike Through Cold Weather Without Losing Health

  • Ingredients: Warm Pepper and Monster Fang

There’s a point in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom wherein players will have to hike up Hebra Mountain to get to a dungeon called Lanayru Temple. This area is chilly and will actively deplete hearts. To correct this status effect, players can spawn torches around them or they can drink things like a Warming Potion.

This will combat the cold by giving players the Chill-Proof boon for five minutes. It can be crafted with a Warm Pepper and a Monster Fang. There is an alternative concoction to this called a Warm Rocktato Smoothie. It will only grant three minutes of Chill-Proof but it will restore some energy to the Swordfighter form meter in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom . Players need a Warm Pepper and a Rocktato for this smoothie.

5 Golden Chilly Smoothie

Restore Health And Become Fire-Proof

  • Ingredients: Chilly Cactus and Golden Egg

The Golden Chilly Smoothie performs the opposite effect of the Warming Potion as it will cool players down. It will grant players the Fire-Proof boon for five minutes and it can heal twenty hearts which may be more than what most players have at this point in the game. To craft this smoothie, players will need to find a Chilly Cactus and a Golden Egg which is one of the rarest crating materials in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom .

The Golden Chilly Smoothie is a great concoction to have when traveling the Eldin Volcano area, especially inside the Eldin Temple dungeon. There’s lava and heated floors all over the place and it can help the most during the boss fight against Volvagia who is a classic dragon in the Zelda series. An alternative to the Golden Chilly Smoothie would be the Chilly Potion which still grants five minutes of Fire-Proof but there is no health recovery. Players need to substitute the Golden Egg for the Monster Guts to craft it.

4 Golden Rapid Smoothie

Restore Health And Swim Faster

  • Ingredients: Riverhorse and Golden Egg

The Golden Rapid Smoothie is another drink that needs the illustrious Golden Egg along with the Riverhorse material. It can heal twenty hearts and it will grant players five minutes of extra swimming speed. Water is all over Hyrule but players will need it the most when they are in the Jabul Waters region of the map. From exploring the map and finding side quests in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom to venturing into that region’s dungeon, there are going to be some large swim-based trials.

Lord Jabu-Jabu and Vocavor are tough bosses without swimming enhancements. An alternative would be the Zora’s Flippers accessory which players can buy in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom . Another solution would be the Rapid Potion which boosts swimming speed for five minutes and players just need a Riverhorse and a Monster Fang for that.

3 Golden Twisty Smoothie

Become The Master Of Automatons With Sped Up Winding

  • Ingredients: Twisted Pumpkin and Golden Egg

The Golden Twisty Smoothie will be a good one to mix up once players start making automatons with Dampe in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom. He can be found in Hyrule Field once players progress through returning Hyrule Castle to normal. Dampe, with the right materials, can make robotic versions of monsters to aid in battle. They don’t cost Tri any power in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom either, so it’s like gaining a new ally.

To use these automatons, players have to wind them up first with a key. The Golden Twisty Smoothie speeds up this process for five minutes and it will heal players for twenty hearts. Players need to gather a Twisted Pumpkin and a Golden Egg for this drink. Alternatively, players can craft a Twisty Potion with a Monster Fang and a Twisted Pumpkin that will focus on the speed enhancement alone.

2 Golden Tough Smoothie

Restore Health And Boost Defense

  • Ingredients: Touch Mango and Golden Egg

The Golden Tough Smoothie will heal hearts, predictably, but it will also boost defense for five minutes. Some accessories will do this as well, but other than that and the smoothie, there are no other ways to make Zelda tougher defensively. She can collect costumes by using Amiibo in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom but they won’t boost stats like clothes in The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild .

Stat boosting aside, the Golden Tough Smoothie can be made with a Tough Mango and a Golden Egg. By using Monster Guts instead of the Golden Egg, players can make a Tough Potion to boost defense for five minutes. Also, adding Tough Mangoes to most ingredients will add a defensive boost to a smoothie, so players should try experimenting.

1 Salted Milky Smoothie

Restore Health And Energy

  • Ingredients: Fresh Milk and Rock Salt

The Salted Milky Smoothie boils things down to the two essentials of The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom . Players need to heal and they need to regain energy used by the Swordfighter form. Players are probably going to have an abundance of Fresh Milk and Rock Salt ingredients from chests, side quests, and monster drops.

That makes crafting this drink easy, so players should fill up a majority of their inventory with this smoothie right before a main dungeon. It only heals ten hearts but it will replenish all lost energy which is the better perk. The longer players can assume the Swordfighter form, the easier time they will have in the game. It’s as simple as that to make it the number one smoothie in all of Hyrule.

item.title: Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster Has The Weight of The World On Its Shoulders
item.description:
In the evolving landscape of video game remasters allowing major franchises to exist across generations, Capcom's recent Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster has found itself playing a critical role for its IP. This return to Frank West's mall escapades is now serving as more than just a nostalgic update of the past, as it also seems to be carrying the heavy expectation of determining the future of Dead Rising itself.

The initial reception to Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster has been generally positive in the face of its visual upgrades and quality-of-life enhancements, but there are still several challenges and criticisms which could significantly impact the overall legacy of the series. Following comments from developers, it's become clear that Capcom will be weighing the performance of this remaster against any risks associated with giving Dead Rising 2 the same treatment.

Capcom's History of Using Remasters to Test the Viability of Franchises in Hiatus

Several Major Series Haven't Been Continued After Falling Short of Capcom's Projections with Remaster Releases

There is now a well-documented history of Capcom utilizing remasters as barometers for the viability of franchises that have been dormant for years. Titles like Mega Man Legacy Collection and the remastered Darkstalkers Resurrection collection have been subjected to scrutiny that could be considered excessive for re-releases, as their sales have helped to dictate whether further entries would eventually see the light of day.

In the case of this series, the release of Dead Rising 4 has done more harm than good for the perception of the IP. This has put far more pressure on Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster to perform commercially, as it's easily the most unanimously well-received entry in several years. The investment that was required to bring it into the modern fidelity of the RE Engine makes Capcom's standards somewhat understandable, but it also makes any backlash that Deluxe Remaster has received regarding issues like audio mixing or gameplay changes have all the more significant bearing on future projects.

The Future of the IP is Likely Riding On Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster's Success

A Remaster of Dead Rising 2 Could Be on the Horizon if Capcom is Satisfied

Following producer Kei Morimoto's statements about a potential Dead Rising 2 remaster, it seems that Capcom's future strategy will continue to be linked to the sales of the currently released Deluxe Remaster . There's certainly a wave of nostalgia driving the success of DR 's return, but it might be unreasonable to think that this kind of hype should be equal to what kind of excitement would bring in sales for an actual brand-new title. Despite this reality, it's been indicated that whether players get to once again step into the role of Chuck Greene will be determined by the profit generated by Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster.

The Expectations of Dead Rising Deluxe Remasters Sales Might Be Higher Than Many Fans Anticipate

The sales numbers associated with similar releases for other series under Capcom's umbrella could be considered impressive in their own rights, regardless of its desired figures. The fact that a Darkstalkers collection managed to sell decently at all as updated arcade games has been seen as an indicator of interest among its community, but the company hasn't been satisfied enough to return to that iconic series.

Given that Deluxe Remaster offers its players far more fidelity through its updates, however, it does have the genuine potential to far surpass those past outings in terms of commercial performance. It might also be true that Capcom will accordingly adjust its standards by greatly heightening them in this case, though, so even several million sales might not be enough to justify a return to Dead Rising 2 . Only time will tell.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Zapdos, & Shiny Galarian Moltres
item.description:
Pokemon GO debuts Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Zapdos, and Shiny Galarian Moltres during the Galarian Expedition 2024 event. While the Standard variants were available for a long time, collectors were eager to get their hands on their Shiny counterparts. You can finally get all three of these Legendary Galarian Shinies through Daily Adventure Incense.

Legendary Shiny Pokemon are rare catches that require intense grinding to encounter. Even if you encounter a Legendary Shiny, the chances of it fleeing are high. But, the same cannot be said about the Legendary Bird trio; the developers have provided an advantageous situation for the Galarian Expedition 2024 event participants. That said, this guide details the best way to catch Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Zapdos, and Shiny Galarian Moltres in Pokemon GO .

Pokemon GO: Get Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Zapdos, & Shiny Galarian Moltres

Unlike other Legendary Shinies, you cannot get these Shiny Galarian bird trio as raid rewards. Pokemon GO trainers can only encounter Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Moltres, and Shiny Galarian Zapdos using the Daily Adventure Incense in the wild. This Incense is available once a day, and you can access it at the top right of the game screen.

You can encounter Shiny Galarian Articuno, Moltres, and Zapdos in the wild, but a Shiny encounter isn’t guaranteed. While that is the case, all three Shiny Galarian birds will not flee when you try to catch them. You must keep traversing through the map and use the Daily Adventure Incense regularly to increase your chances of a Shiny encounter.

The only challenging task is to encounter Shiny Galarian Articuno, Shiny Galarian Zapdos, and Shiny Galarian Moltres in Pokemon GO . You can use the Weather Boost effect to increase the chances of these Shiny Galarian birds spawning.

Galarian Articuno

  • Maximum Combat Power: 4059 CP
  • Attack Stat: 250
  • Defense Stat: 197
  • Stamina Stat: 207
  • Weather Boost: Windy weather

Galarian Zapdos

  • Maximum Combat Power: 4012 CP
  • Attack Stat: 252
  • Defense Stat: 189
  • Stamina Stat: 207
  • Weather Boost: Cloudy and Windy weather

Galarian Moltres

  • Maximum Combat Power: 3580 CP
  • Attack Stat: 202
  • Defense Stat: 231
  • Stamina Stat: 207
  • Weather Boost: Foggy and Windy weather

All three of these monsters’ Weather Boost effect triggers in areas with Windy weather . Activate a Pokemon GO Daily Adventure Incense and walk around areas with Windy areas ; you might encounter any of the three Shiny Galarian birds. Remember that you can encounter any of these Shiny Pokemon even after the Galarian Expedition 2024 event ends.

Stock up on Poke Balls or use a Pokemon GO Master Ball to ensure catching the Legendary Shinies.

item.title: Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed - Trophy/Achievement Guide
item.description:
The 2010 classic platformer from Disney has been reimagined, with Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed releasing to consoles it wasn't previously aligned with. With this remaster comes a host of new features and, of course, the ability for players to collect those achievements and trophies for their in-game feats.

For players looking to add the latest Mickey Mouse adventure to their digital trophy cabinet, there are a number of objectives that must first be fulfilled. For a complete list of all Epic Mickey: Rebrushed trophies and how to get them, simply refer to the below guide.

All Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed Trophies (& How To Get Them)

There are a total of 38 in-game trophies/achievements in Epic Mickey: Rebrushed , with PlayStation's platinum making it 39 for those who play on the Sony console. Many of these will be picked up naturally on your playthrough, but to get them all you'll need to do a Paint run and a Thinner run. Here's how to complete your collection

Trophy Name

Description

How To Get

Full of Beans

Complete the first side-scrolling level

This one you'll get organically in the early stages of the story. As you leave the first world, you'll go through a projector to the first Beanstalk level. Once you've completed this by finding the projector exit, you'll receive this trophy.

Small World

Paint or Thin the mad Clock Tower

This is the first boss of the game. To beat it, you'll need to use Paint or Thinner on its arms and hands while dodging strikes. If you're wanting to take the hero path, then use Paint. If you want the anti-hero journey, then use Thinner. For the sake of later trophies, its best to stick with the same one for the duration of your playthrough.

Collector

Repair the Mickeyjunk projector

This world will be unlocked as you progress through the game - it's crucial to the story progression. To get to Mickeyjunk Mountain, you'll need to have the Gremlin lower the bridge in Ostown, which will require Mickey to fetch his wrench.

World of Tomorrow

Repair the Tomorrow City Projector

Same as above, you won't miss this one as it is part of the main story. It'll be unlocked once you make it to Mean Street and find all of the decommissioned projectors.

Spin to Win!

Paint or Thin Petetronic

The second major boss. You'll need to use Mickey's Spin Attack to deflect his discs, then fill the mechanism on his back with either Paint or Thinner when he is dizzy.

Oh, the cleverness of me!

Repair the Pirates of the Wasteland projector

This will happen as part of the story, but is one of the later stages of the game. So, expect that this will come after a few other worlds have been unlocked. Once you get to Adventureland, complete the three missions, including "A Pirate's Love" and acquire the items you need to give to Smee. Once he has them, the projector will be repaired.

Tick-Tock

Paint or Thin the animatronic Captain Hook

For this one, the "Paint" option actually involves freeing the spirit. So bypass the battle with Hook on the deck and climb the stairs to the left. Climb up to the top and traverse the platforms until you reach the cage, and break it open. For Thinner, defeat Hook on the deck without Peter's help.

Awaken the Spirits

Repair the Lonesome Manor projector

Lonesome Manor is one of the final stages, where Mickey will encounter the Mad Doctor. It'll be unlocked as part of the main story.

Caboom!

Thwart the Mad Doctor's plans

For the Paint playthrough, rescuing the Gremlins prior to the final fight with the Mad Doctor will actually do most of the work for you and destroy two of the Beetleworx generators. For the third one, use the TV on the middle platform then quickly use the Watch Sketch to slow time. Then, put the Anvil on the platform closest to the Doctor, then stand on the third one. You may need to use a couple of Watch sketches back-to-back.

Tentacular

Defeat the Bloticles attacking each of the hubs

This is a story mission and requires players to use paint or thinner on the green spots on the tentacles to get rid of them. You'll need to do this on every world to progress to the final battle and unlock the trophy.

Shadow of the Blot

Defeat the Shadow Blot atop Mickeyjunk Mountain

Venture to Mickeyjunk Mountain and battle the Shadow Blot while Oswald tries to keep the Blot from escaping its prison in the bottle.

Escape Wasteland

Escape the inside of the Blot and save Wasteland

Meet Oswald and activate the three towers to execute the plan to defeat the Shadow Blot, then defeat the Bloticles inside the Blot to release Mickey's heart.

Mickanically Gifted

Repair 3 rides in the Gremlin Village region

The Gremlin Village is the first world you'll find after the introductory stages of the game. The three rides you need to repair are the Teacup, the Elephant ride, and . The Teacup requires filling the mechanism with Paint, the Elephant requires a wrench, which is hidden in one of the teacups (you'll need Thinner to find it),

Photo Op

Use Photo Mode and save a favorite photo

Photo mode can be accessed from the pause menu, then simply follow the button prompts to take a photo and save it.

Gawrsh!

Collect all parts of Animatronic Goofy

You'll first encounter Animatronic Goofy in Ostown, by the fountain in the center of the town. His four parts can be found scattered throughout Tomorrow City, but be sure to check the Emporium if you miss any, as I found a couple of parts for sale there.

Oh, goody goody!

Collect all parts of Animatronic Daisy

Animatronic Daisy is found in Adventureland, but her four parts can be found scattered throughout Pirates of the Wasteland.

Aw, phooey!

Collect all parts of Animatronic Donald

Rescue Donald Duck in his expressive Animatronic form, which can be found in Bog Easy. You will need to search Lonesome Manor for his four missing parts.

Heavy Hitter

Unlock the Anvil Sketch

You will find the Anvil in a red chest on the roof of lonesome manor. Before you can get into the manor, you'll need to thin the pillars and climb to the second floor balcony. The chest is on the left.

Cartoon Chaos

Unlock the TV Sketch

This is unlocked in Tomorrowland automatically, after you defeat the Slobber mini-boss.

Time is an Illusion

Unlock the Watch Sketch

In Tortooga, you'll be tasked with helping Billy retrieve his lost treasure. Once you complete this mission, he'll give you the sketch.

Suit Up!

Put on a costume for the first time

Costumes can be found from the pause menu. There are two to unlock, three acquirable via pre-orders, and addition costumes are able to be purchased.

Street Cleaner

Repaint all of Mean Street

This one is easy in theory but can be tricky to complete. You will need to search the ground, all the walls, and climb to the rooftops and paint every single paintable surface in Mean Street.

Dial Tone

Dial the wrong number on a phone 3 times

There are two large phones in Mickeyjunk Mountain that you can dial for a quest from Mickey's phone and to activate machinery in the level. Simply jump on any number that isn't a correct input to get this trophy.

Eraser

Thin 50 enemies

Use Thinner to beat 50 Blotlings in the game.

Painter

Paint (befriend) 50 enemies

Use Paint to beat 50 Blotlings in the game.

Mickey Uncaged

Free 12 Gremlins from their cages

This one is almost impossible to miss, as there are an abundance of Gremlins that are trapped in cages. The first one you encounter is an optional save, but there are plenty of others you'll find along the way.

Gilded

Beat Gilda's best time in all of her races

Beat Gilda's races in Mean Street, Ostown, Bog Easy, and Adventureland. Simply run through all the rings before the time expires to beat her.

It's Over One Thousand!!!

Collect 1,001 E-Tickets

This one is fairly simple, you can find E-Tickets by destroying any shiny items, Thinning items, and beating enemies.

Fragile

Destroy 100 destructables

Desctructable objects will be easily identifiable as they are somewhat shiny. You can break them with Mickey's Spin Attack or Dash ability.

Battle Ready

Fully upgrade Mickey's heart containers

Collect all Heart Upgrades. These can be acquired from some vendors and by completing certain quests. One can be purchased from the Ice Cream Shop in Mean Street, Travis in Ventureland, another for collecting enough Film Reels, and one for giving Oswald Ortensia's locket. You'll also receive one for rescuing Ostwon from the Bloticles

Clumsy Lifeguard

Knock 10 enemies into Thinner

This one can be achieved by using Thinner on platforms to make enemies fall into the lakes or rivers of green Thinner, or by using Mickey's Dash and Spin Attacks repeatedly until they fall in there.

Square Eyes

Use the TV Sketch to attract the attention of 5 Blotlings simultaneously

This can be down at any point where you're dealing with a bunch of Blotlings at once. Simply use the TV Sketch when there are multiple Blotlings trying to attack you.

Moviegoer

Collect 36 Film Reels

Each side-scrolling level has two Film Reels, so be sure to check every corner of each level for them. This one will be pretty easy to get, as there are well over 30 projector levels in the game.

Faulty Machinery

Defeat each kind of Beetleworx once

This one will be difficult to miss, unless you actively go out of your way to not beat the Beetleworx (although, I'm not sure you can in some story situations). Use your Thinner to expose their weak points, then Spin Attack them.

Feisty Friends

Have a total of 5 Blotlings painted simultaneously

When you have a bunch of enemies around you, convert them one-by-one with Paint so they fight alongside you.

Get Off Me!

Knock back 3 enemies with one Spin Attack

This is best done with small bunnies. Wait for them to crowd around you before triggering the attack.

An Epic Journey

Use paint to defeat all the bosses and repair all Animatronics

On your Paint-heavy run, use Paint to beat all the bosses and collect the parts for Animatronic Goofy, Donald, and Daisy.

Out of my way

Use thinner to defeat all the bosses and leave all Animatronics disassembled

Go on a villain run with Mickey Mouse and use Thinner to beat all bosses and ignore the Animatronic quests.
